intro: Cacalia reniformis, commonly known as the kidneyleaf bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its kidney-shaped leaves and bell-like blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It is often found in coastal scrub and chaparral habitats, where it contributes to the local biodiversity. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in some regions.
